rules.title: War Engines
description: Units with the unit type H-AV can take two damage before they are killed, and counts as two units for Outnumber, Blast Markers, number of attacks in an assault, hit allocation and the maximum number of units in base contact. H-AV are treated as WE when hit by weapons that do multiple points of damage (e.g. TK(D3)). In addition it is possible to critically hit H-AVs. If a Critical Hit is rolled, the unit is destroyed with no further effects. H-AVs may be targeted by Pin-Point attacks, but does not target individual models. Instead, hits are randomized in the formation. H-AVs are treated like normal Armoured Vehicles in all other respects.

rules.title: Machine Spirit
description: Unless within 15cm of a friendly unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule, a formation that exclusively consists of units with Machine Spirit may only perform the Hold, Engage, Marshal, Sustained Fire and Overwatch actions. In addition, such formations may only contest objectives, and always counts as being within 30cm of an enemy formation when attempting to Rally.

rules.title: Cybernetica Cortex
description: Unless within 30cm of an unbroken friendly unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule, a formation that exclusively consists of units with the 'Cybernetica Cortex' special rule may only perform the Hold, Engage, Marshal, Sustained Fire, and Overwatch actions. In addition, such formations may only contest objectives, and always counts as being within 15cm of an enemy formation when rallying.

rules.title: Cybernetica Cortex (Defensive)
description: Unless within 15cm of a friendly unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule, a formation that exclusively consists of units with the 'Cybernetica Cortex (Defensive)' special rule may only perform the Hold, Sustained Fire, and Overwatch actions. In addition, such formations may only contest objectives.

rules.title: Cybernetica Cortex (Offensive)
description: Unless within 15cm of a friendly unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule, a formation that exclusively consists of units with the 'Cybernetica Cortex (Offensive)' special rule may only perform the Hold, Engage, and Advance actions. In addition, such formations may only contest objectives.

rules.title: Cybertheurgy
description: A unit with the 'Cybertheurgy' special rule removes its 'Cybernetica Cortex' special rule, and the formation it is part of gains an additional +1 to rally.

rules.title: Animus Malefica
description: A unit with the 'Animus Malefica' special rule removes its 'Cybernetica Cortex' special rule, and the formation it is part of gains an additional +1 to activate. However, if a formation that contains a unit with this special rule fails to activate, the formation suffers D3 BMs instead of one.

rules.title: Silica Animus
description: A unit with the 'Silica Animus' special rule removes its 'Cybernetica Cortex' special rule, and the formation it is part of gains an additional +1 to activate and to rally. However, if a formation that contains a unit with this special rule fails to activate, the formation suffers D6 BMs instead of one.

rules.title: Construct Shields
description: Construct Shields work in exactly the same manner as Void Shields (see Void Shields), except that they may not be repaired once they have been knocked down by a hit, and will instead remain down for the remainder of the battle.

rules.title: Atomantic Shielding
description: Atomantic Shields work exactly like an Invulnerable Save, except if a 1 is rolled when using the save, the shield explodes. All units within 5cm takes a hit on 6+.

rules.title: Dispersion Field (x)
description: A Dispersion Field provide a saving throw to the value of x, which is reduced by 2 (e.g. 3+ to 5+) at the start of each subsequent turn. When the Dispersion Field reaches 7+ or higher it is no longer considered to be operable and thus confers no save.

This save may always be taken even against weapons with the Macro Weapon or Titan Killer abilities. If a unit has Reinforced Armour it may use its re-roll unless hit by a Lance, Macro Weapon or Titan Killer attack but the re-roll uses the units armour value. Hits saved by the Dispersion Field do not generate Blast Markers, even if they have the Disrupt ability.
Against Titan Killer attacks that cause extra damage make one Dispersion Field save roll, if this is successful the unit takes no damage, if the roll fails it suffers all the damage.

rules.title: Void Shields
description: Each void shield will automatically stop one point of damage and then go down. Do not make armour saves for damage stopped by Void Shields. If the formation is broken, its Void Shields are considered to have the 'Expendable' special rule. Downed Void Shields does not count as kills during assaults (but will still cause BMs on the winning formation).

Once all of the shields have been knocked down, the War Engine may be damaged normally and you may make saving throws against any hits that are scored. Hits from close combat ignore void shields but units using their firefight values must first knock down any shields before they can damage the Titan.
Void shields that have been knocked down can be repaired. Each War Engine can repair one downed Void Shield in the End Phase of each turn.
In addition, if a War Engine regroups (either by performing a Hold or a Marshal action) it may use the dice roll both to repair Void Shields and remove Blast Markers.

rules.title: Void Shields
description: Each void shield will automatically stop one point of damage and then go down. Do not make armour saves or allocate Blast Markers for damage stopped by Void Shields. Downed Void Shields does not count as kills during assaults (but will still cause BMs on the winning formation).

Once all of the shields have been knocked down, the War Engine may be damaged normally and you may make saving throws against any hits that are scored. Hits from close combat ignore void shields but units using their firefight values must first knock down any shields before they can damage the Titan.
Void shields that have been knocked down can be repaired. Each War Engine can repair one downed Void Shield in the End Phase of each turn.
In addition, if a War Engine regroups (either by performing a Hold or a Marshal action) it may use the dice roll both to repair Void Shields and remove Blast Markers.

rules.title: God Machine (x)
description: Whenever a unit with the 'God Machine' special rule is destroyed that isn't an army BTS, the opponent scores (x) additional Victory Points. In addition, whenever a unit with this special rule is destroyed, all friendly formations within 45 cm suffers (x) Blast Markers.

rules.title: Split Fire
description: A War Engine with this special rule may declare that it will Split Fire when shooting with any action. The WE may fire at up to two enemy formations with an additional -1 modifier to hit, but may not target more than one formation per individual weapon.

rules.title: Ripple Fire
description: A War Engine with this special rule may declare that it will Ripple Fire when shooting with any action. The WE may fire at up to three enemy formations with an additional -1 modifier to hit, but may not target more than one formation per individual weapon.

rules.title: Stomp ’em Good
description: A War Engine with this special rule may declare that it will Split Fire when attempting to perform a Sustain Fire action, suffering a -1 modifier on the roll. Regardless if the action succeeds or if the formation is forced to Hold, the WE may fire at up to two enemy formations, but may not target more than one formation per individual weapon.

rules.title: Adeptus Custodians
description: Adeptus Custodian are renowned for their tenacity and bravery. This is represented by the following rules:
* It takes 2 Blast Markers to suppress a Adeptus Custodian unit.
* Adeptus Custodian formations are only broken if they have 2 Blast Markers per unit in the formation.

* Adeptus Custodian formations only count half their number of Blaster markers in assault resolution (rounding down—note that assault resolution will not receive +1 for having no Blast Markers if the formation has 1 Blast Marker before rounding down).

* When a broken Adeptus Custodian formation rallies, it receives a number of Blast Markers equal to the number of units, rather than half this number. Adeptus Custodians with the Leader special ability remove 2 Blast Markers instead of 1

* All Adeptus Custodian units are consider fearless in all respects except they still have to end their move while broken outside of 15cm of an enemy foramtion. If they cant they are subject to standard hackdowns rules for broken non fearless units with in 15cm of a enemy unit taking into account the above rules for Adeptus Custodians and Blast Markers.

rules.title: Support Craft
description: Support Craft are Skimmers, which for all line of sight and terrain purposes count as ‘popped up’ at all times. If the Support Craft has a transport option, it may embark and disembark units as normal. Embarked units are allowed a save (see 1.7.5) if the Support Craft is destroyed.

Support Craft do not block line of sight, must always use their Skimmer ability to force a firefight in engagements and Infantry in base contact with a Support Craft may not use it to count as being in cover.

rules.title: Tunneling Transports
description: Formations including units with both the Transport and Tunneler special rules must start the game in the reserves, and may only enter the battlefield through tunneling. War Engines with these special rules may not start the game empty, but must transport another formation.

rules.title: Shield Disruptor
description: Each point of damage from a hit with Shield Disruptor will knock down two Powerfields, Shadowfields or Void Shields. If a unit with only one field remaining is hit the field knocked down, but the hit does not carry over. In addition, Shield Disruptor hits ignores Ion Shields and Dispersion Fields.

rules.title: Warriors of the Void
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage or March action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Army of Mankind
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Advance or Overwatch action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Veterans of the Great Crusade
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out a Sustain Fire or Marshal action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Superior Firepower
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Advance or Double action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character

rules.title: Tenacious in Adversity
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage or Double action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: A Lean Race of Killers
description: All Solar Auxilia Sections receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage or Sustain Fire action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: The Muster of Worlds
description: All Imperialis Militia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Overwatch action, does not suffer a BM when forced to take a 'Hold' action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Feral Warriors
description: All Imperialis Militia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage action, does not suffer a BM when forced to take a 'Hold' action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Abhuman Muster
description: All Imperialis Militia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Double action, does not suffer a BM when forced to take a 'Hold' action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Armoury of Old Night
description: All Imperialis Militia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Sustain Fire action, does not suffer a BM when forced to take a 'Hold' action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Tainted Flesh
description: All Imperialis Militia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Marshal action, does not suffer a BM when forced to take a 'Hold' action, and gains a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with a character.

rules.title: Logic of Victory
description: All Mechanicum Taghmata Cohorts receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Advance, Sustain Fire or Marshal action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests.

rules.title: A Soul of Cold Iron
description: All Mechanicum Taghmata Cohorts receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Advance, Overwatch or Marshal action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests.

rules.title: Malefica Mechanica
description: All Dark Mechanicum Cohorts receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Advance, Sustain Fire, or Engage action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests.

rules.title: Tide of Madness
description: All Ruinstorm formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests as long as the formation contains a unit with the 'Daemonic' or 'Psyker' special rules.

rules.title: Chivalry
description: All Questor Familia formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage or Double action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests.

rules.title: Stubborn
description: Any formation where at least one unit has Stubborn reduce the damage caused by Blast Markers while the formation is broken by one, reduce the number of extra hits from losing an assault by one, requires an additional Blast Marker before the formation becomes broken, and may ignore one Blast Marker when determining suppression.

rules.title: Blitz
description: Units with the 'Blitz' special rule gains an additional 5 cm in speed when conducting an Engage action.

rules.title: Evasive
description: Units with the 'Evasive' special rule may consolidate up to 15 cm after winning an assault, or supporting a winning assault.

rules.title: Steadfast
description: When broken or otherwise forced to take a withdrawal move, a unit with the 'Steadfast' special rule is not destroyed if it ends its movement within 15 cm of the enemy.

rules.title: Ponderous
description: Units with the Ponderous special rule may only make a single withdrawal move instead of two when becoming broken or failing to rally.

rules.title: Vanguard
description: Formations that contains at least one unit with the 'Vanguard' special rule does not suffer -1 to rally when completely on the enemy half of the table.

rules.title: Vox-Caster
description: A formation containing a unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule may be used for carrying out an Offboard Support action as detailed in the 'new actions' part of the rules.

rules.title: Bulky
description: Units with the 'Bulky' special rule takes two spaces to transport.

rules.title: Transport (x)
description: Units with the 'Transport (x)' special rule may transport 'x' number of INF, which may not have the 'Bulky' or 'Mounted' special rules.

rules.title: Heavy Transport (x)
description: Units with the 'Heavy Transport (x)' special rule may transport 'x' number of INF, which may have the 'Bulky' special rule. Each 'Bulky' unit takes two spaces each

rules.title: Assault Transport (x)
description: Units with the 'Assault Transport (x)' special rule may transport 'x' number of INF, which may have the 'Bulky' and 'Mounted' special rules. In addition, it may treat AV or LV with the 'Nimble' special rule as INF. Any unit with these special rules take two spaces to carry.

rules.title: Skirmisher
description: Units with the 'Skirmisher' special rule is in coherency if they are within 10 cm from another unit instead of the usual 5 cm. Units with 'Skirmisher' may garrison according to the same rules as units with 'Scout'.

rules.title: Nimble
description: AV and LV with the 'Nimble' special rule may enter Strongholds like INF, taking two spaces each.

rules.title: Self-Destruct
description: After the first time this weapon has been used, remove the unit from the battlefield. If this special rule has been activated, removing the unit does not count as a casualty during assaults, and does not cause BMs on its formation. Do not allocate hits against this unit during assaults if it is to be removed.

rules.title: Towering
description: Units with the 'Towering' special rule counts as Support Craft for Line of Sight purposes.

rules.title: And They Shall Know No Fear (ATSKNF)
description: Units with ATSKNF can take 2 Blast Markers before they are suppressed, or to kill a unit in a broken formation (ignore any leftover Blast Markers). ATSKNF formations are only broken if they have more than 2 Blast Markers per unit in the formation.

Once the number of Blast Markers on a ATSKNF formation exceeds the number of units / DC, they suffer an additional -1 to activate, and their enemies gain an additional +1 during assault resolution (this is counted before halving).

ATSKNF formations only count half their number of Blaster markers in assault resolution (rounding down to a minimum of one). Halve the number of extra hits suffered by a ATSKNF formation that loses an assault, rounding down in favour of the ATSKNF formation. When a broken formation with ATSKNF rallies, it receives a number of Blast Markers equal to the number of units, rather than half this number.

rules.title: Dauntless
description: Units with Dauntless take 2 Blast Markers to cause one point of damage in a broken formation (ignore any leftover Blast Markers).
Halve the number of extra hits suffered by a Dauntless formation that loses an assault, rounding down in favour of the Dauntless formation.

rules.title: Ion Shield (x)
description: Knights make use of Ion Shields to deflect shooting and firefight attacks. This allows them to make a saving throw on the number within brackets when they are hit by ranged fire instead of using their armour value.

No modifiers ever apply to this saving throw and it is unaffected by Macro-Weapon, Lance and Titan Killer hits (each point of damage from a Titan Killer hit must be saved separately. Is affected normally by hits with the Disrupt special rule). If the unit has Reinforced Armour as well then it is allowed to re-roll a failed save using its armour value unless the hit was a Macro-Weapon, Lance or Titan killer.

Ion Shields may only be used against shooting unless the unit is in a Crossfire, and against FF unless the hit is caused by a unit in support. They may not be used against CC attacks. If relevant, roll CC and FF dice separately when attacking units equipped with Ion Shields.

rules.title: Ionic Flare Shield
description: Knights with Ionic Flare Shield may also use their Ion Shield against CC attacks.

rules.title: Shield Piercer
description: Weapons with the Shield Piercer special rule ignores Invulnerable Save, Ion Shields, Dispersion Fields, Powerfields, Construct Shields and Void Shields.

rules.title: MW
description: The MW special rule ignores armour as normal, but in EA - Heresy such weapons will always have their weapon profile split into AP/AT/AA parts.

rules.title: Energetic
description: Weapons with the 'Energetic' special rule gains an additional +1 to hit when the unit's formation conducts a Sustain Fire action.

rules.title: Titan Hunter
description: Weapons with the 'Titan Hunter' special rule gains an additional +1 to hit against War Engines, but suffers an additional -1 to hit against INF, LV, and AV.

rules.title: Siege
description: Weapons with the 'Siege' special rule gains an additional +1 to hit and the 'Crippling' special rule against Strongholds, and may use AP instead of AT against such targets.

rules.title: Siege Engine
description: Units with the 'Siege Engine' special rule may not garrison.

rules.title: Crippling
description: A weapon with the 'Crippling' special rule causes critical hits on War Engines on a 5+.

rules.title: Rad
description: Weapons with the 'Rad' special rule causes BMs for each hit inflicted, just like weapons with the 'Disrupt' special rule. Unlike 'Disrupt', the 'Rad' special rule does not force their targets to roll armour saves, and they are not removed as casualties for failing to save.

rules.title: Shock Pulse
description: War Engines that suffers at least one hit from a weapon with the 'Shock Pulse' special rule suffers D6 BMs for coming under fire, instead of just one.

rules.title: Graviton(x)
description: Weapons with the 'Graviton(x)' special rule gains the 'MW' and 'TK(x)' special rules against WE and/or any units with the 'Reinforced Armour' special rule.

rules.title: Beam Projector
description: Weapons with the 'Beam Projector' special rule suffers an additional -1 to hit when shooting at a target that at least partially within half range, or an additional -2 to hit within 15 cm.

rules.title: Æther-Fire
description: Weapons with the 'Æther-Fire' special rule gains an additional +1 to hit when the unit's formation conducts an Advance action.

rules.title: Devastating Charge
description: Weapon or Unit gains an additional +1 to hit with CC of FF attacks during the first round of any assaults initiated by the formation, but suffers a -1 penalty to hit with CC or FF attacks during the first round of any assaults initiated by enemy formations.

rules.title: Unstable
description: If a natural 1 is rolled when rolling to hit, roll another dice. If the result is yet another natural 1, the wielder takes one point of damage.

rules.title: Feedback
description: If a unit firing a weapon with the Feedback special rule fails to cause damage when hitting an enemy unit, roll a D6 for each successful armour save the enemy unit made. The firing unit takes a blast marker for each 1 rolled.

rules.title: Singularity
description: When rolling to hit with a Singularity weapon, any unmodified to hit roll of six (6) generates an additional attack die. Successive rolls of a natural six can generate additional dice.

rules.title: Psybolts
description: Weapons with the Psybolts special rule ignores Invulnerable Save and Regenerate.

rules.title: Primarch
description: Units with the 'Primarch' unit type have Damage Capacity like WE but act as INF in all other aspects. The Primarch also counts as being Supreme Commander, which means that the army may have two Supreme Commander re-rolls per turn. The Primarch unit counts as an additional BTS in the army, which means that this objective can be lost twice.

rules.title: Force
description: A weapon with the 'Force' special rule counts as having the 'Sniper' special rule against units with the 'Daemonic' or 'Psyker' special rules.

rules.title: Psyker
description: Teleporting units placed within 15 cm of any enemy units with the 'Psyker' special rule suffer Teleport Mishap for any 1 and 2 rolled, instead of just 1.

rules.title: Perils of the Warp
description: Roll two dice whenever attempting to use a weapon with this special rule. On a roll of a 3-5, it cannot be used this turn. On a roll of 2, the unit wielding the weapon suffers a hit, and its formation suffers a BM for having come under fire.

rules.title: Daemonic
description: Units with the 'Daemonic' special rule counts as being twice as many (or having twice as many DC) for determining 'outnumber' during assault. Units with the 'Daemonic' special rule are automatically destroyed if it is part of a formation that loses an assault, unless they also have the 'Fearless' special rule.
Enemy Teleporting units placed within 15 cm of any enemy units with the 'Daemonic' special rule suffer Teleport Mishap for any 1 and 2 rolled, instead of just 1.

rules.title: Prescience
description: Formations that include a unit with the 'Prescience' special rule may ignore the -1 penalty to Action test rolls when attempting to retain the Initiative.

rules.title: Fortified Positions
description: Fortified Positions are set up at the same time as the formation they are bought with. Units from such formations must be set up within the fortified positions, so that no space is left empty. All pieces of fortified positions must be within 5cm from another piece. Once set up, Fortified Positions counts as terrain that do not block Line of Sight, and may be used by either side. Units of INF that benefit from Cover inside a Fortified Position may only be Barged by WE in such a way that they are not moved outside of their Fortified Position.
Gun Emplacement: Provides a Cover Save of 4+ one unit of INF, or a 5+ Cover Save to one unit of AV or LV (but not H-AV).
Bunker: Provides a Cover Save of 3+ and Thick Rear Armour to up to three units of INF. Counts as Dangerous Terrain for AV and WE. Bunkers can be a maximum of 8cm x 8cm in size.
Trench: Provides a cover save of 4+ to INF. May contain one unit of INF per 4cm of lenght. Counts as Dangerous Terrain for AV.

Razor Wire: Counts as Dangerous Terrain for all INF, including those that have the Mounted special rule. Razor Wire dangerous terrain tests may not be re-rolled using the Walker ability (units may still 'move carefully' through such terrain). Razor Wire must be set up so that every piece touches another piece from the same group, with no gap in between.

Minefields: Counts as Dangerous Terrain for all types of units. Minefield dangerous terrain tests may not be re-rolled using the Walker ability (units may still 'move carefully' through such terrain). Skimmers and units with 'Jump Packs' moving over Minefields must also take dangerous terrain tests. Minefields must be set up so that every piece touches another piece from the same group, with no gap in between.

rules.title: Air Superiority
description: Elysian Drop Troops may ignore one blast marker when rolling to activate aircraft formations.

In addition, Elysian Drop Troops may instead of starting with garrisons on overwatch place aircrafts on Combat Air Patrol. Up to two formations may start on overwatch or CAP. Aircraft formation placed on CAP in this way will follow all the normal rules for CAP, but are setup during the pre-game garrisoning phase.

rules.title: Siege Specialists
description: Units may re-roll failed dangerous terrain tests when making a move through Minefields or Razor Wire on the friendly part of the table, and units with Walker may use it against Minefields or Razor Wire on the enemy part of the table.
In addition, up to three formations that garrison may start on Overwatch instead of the usual two.

rules.title: Siegemasters
description: Units may re-roll failed dangerous terrain tests when making a move through Minefields or Razor Wire on the friendly part of the table, and units with 'Walker' may use it against Minefields or Razor Wire on the enemy part of the table.

In addition, up to three formations that garrison may start on Overwatch instead of the usual two, and up to two formations that garrison ignore the requirement to have one unit within 15cm of an objective on the friendly half of the table.

rules.title: Tunnelers
description: Tunnellers may be set up touching their own side's table edge before the battle starts, just after objectives have been placed. Any units transported in tunnellers should be placed to one side at this time too. Secretly write down the location where the tunneller will surface at the same time and in the same manner that you record the coordinates of a drop zone (see 4.3.1). You must also secretly record the turn the tunneller will surface. If it is going to surface within 30cm of a table edge within the deployment zone, it may arrive from the first turn. If it is going to surface within 65cm of a table edge within the deployment zone, it may appear on turn two. It can appear on any part of the battlefield from the third turn.

Set up the tunneller units at the start of the stated turn, before determining who wins the strategy roll, at the location you wrote down. Surfacing does not count as movement for the purposes of triggering enemy overwatch fire. If a tunneller would have surfaced on terrain that is impassable for it, under a friendly unit, or in an enemy zone of control, then it is assumed that on-board sensor equipment would divert it towards another entry point. The unit should be moved to the nearest area where it can surface.

Formations of multiple tunnellers need only record one location where they will surface. Place the first tunneller unit at this location. All other tunneller units must be placed within 5cm of another tunneller unit that has already been placed and fully within a 15cm radius of the original surfacing coordinates, which can be beyond where tunnellers could appear that turn. Tunnelers do not have to roll for dangerous or difficult terrain when they appear. After all tunnellers have been placed any units being transported are allowed to disembark immediately, and may disembark on the enemy half of the table (if they appear in turn 2).
Disembarking triggers overwatch fire as normal. Tunnellers, and any units being transported in them, may take an action on the turn they appear.

rules.title: Self Planetfall
description: Self Planetfall is plotted exactly as planetfall (see 4.4). Both the turn in which the formation arrives and the landing location is plotted. The only exception is that, because these units are much smaller than orbiting spacecraft, they may be plotted to arrive in the same turn that another spacecraft is present. On the designated turn the formation conducting Self Planetfall is activated in the normal activation sequence, as with spacecraft. Nominate the action for the formation and roll to activate. If the formation fails to activate its arrival is delayed to the next following turn. If the activation is successful, place the formation at the plotted landing zone and determine scatter according to 4.4 as if it were a normal planetfall, including loaded units disembarking up to 5cm. The formation’s action proceeds as normal in all respects from that point. In other words, the formation gets the “free move” from planetfall placement at the beginning of its action but in all other ways activates as normal. Note: The action is chosen at activation, before scatter is determined. Choose the action carefully as a poor scatter roll could render some actions ineffective.

rules.title: Faithful
description: When performing an Engage that leads to an Assault (i.e. at least one unit is within 15cm of an enemy unit), units that have the 'Faithful' special rule gain Fearless, and the formation counts as having one additional character with the 'Inspiring' special rule. These effects lasts until the end of the current turn, but are lost if all units with 'Faithful' in the formation are destroyed.

rules.title: Bionics
description: Characters with the Bionics special rule increases the Armour of their unit to 3+ when added to a unit of INF.

rules.title: Machine Empathy
description: As long as a formation contains a unit with the 'Machine Empathy' special ability, all LV and AV units in the formation gains Invulnerable Save. Units that already have Invulnerable Save gains Regeneration instead.

rules.title: Psychic Succour
description: As long as a formation contains a unit with the 'Psychic Succour' special ability, all INF units in it gains Invulnerable Save.

rules.title: Commander
description: A unit with the Commander special rule can order another unactivated formation to follow them when they make an assault, as long as the formation have at least one unit within 15 cm of the unit with the Commander special rule. Make a single initiative roll for both formations, counting a -1 modifier if any have Blast markers. If the test is failed then both formations receives a Blast marker. The formation with the Commander must take a hold action, but the other formation may take an action later in the turn.

If the test is passed then both formations may take an engage action. Treat the two formations as if they were a single formation for all rules purposes for the duration of the assault. A 2D6 roll is used to resolve a combined assault. If the attackers lose then each formation is broken. If they win then each formation receives a number of Blast markers equal to the casualties it suffered in the combat.

The Commander rule can also be used to defend against enemy assaults, by declaring that one friendly formation within 5 cm of the formation where the Commander is located becomes intermingled in the assault, in the same manner as if the opponent had done this declaration. Defensive and Offensive use of the Commander special rule may only be done once for each side in an assault, no matter how many units with Commander are involved.

rules.title: Born in the Saddle
description: White Scars are masters of lightning-fast hit-and-run attacks, never allowing the enemy to force a decisive or static engagement. Units with Born in the Saddle may consolidate 15cm instead of the usual 5cm.

rules.title: Wind-Swift
description: Units with Wind-Swift ignore the -1 to hit penalty on shooting when carrying out a double action, but do not gain the +1 to hit bonus on shooting when carrying out a sustained fire action.

rules.title: Descent of Angels
description: Units in a formation with Stormravens does not have to roll for scatter when using the Planetfall special rule. Place the first Stormraven within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.

rules.title: Lucifer Pattern Engine
description: Units with the Lucifer Pattern Engine special rule gain an additional 5cm speed when carrying out an Engage action.

rules.title: Blood Angels Rhinos
description: Blood Angels formations with 'plus transport' may take Blood Angels Rhinos instead of normal Rhinos.

rules.title: Pack Mentality
description: Space Wolves Packs counts as having one character with the Inspiring special rule when they initiate an assault where they have another formation with the Pack Mentality special rule in support, or when they perform a combined assault where more than one formation in the assault has Pack Mentality. You will never receive more than plus one Inspiring from Pack Mentality, even if you do both a combined assault and have formations in support, or if you have multiple formations in support.

rules.title: Apocalyptic Barrage
description: Uses the Orbital Barrage Template instead of the ordinary template.

rules.title: Independent
description: The Independent special rule allows a War Engine formation to operate as two independent War Engines for all purposes, including for determining the army BTS (each unit counts as its own formation worth half of the points value of the original formation, including upgrades). If one of the two War Engines are destroyed, the surviving one immediately recieves a Blast Marker.

rules.title: Honour Guard
description: Units with the Honour Guard special rule gain the 'Fearless' and 'Blitz' special rules as long as their formation contains a character with the 'Primarch' unit type.

rules.title: Land Speeder Escort
description: All types of Land Speeders bought as part of the 'Raven Guard Land Speeders' upgrade gain the Planetfall special rule (only roll to scatter once for the entire formation). In addition, such Land Speeders may start the game transported in an air transport, taking up no transport space, and count as having the Jump Packs special rule when disembarking their transport. They may not be picked up again once on the battlefield.

rules.title: Expert Reconnaissance
description: Friendly Raven Guard formations that enter the battlefield through Planetfall that are placed within 30cm of a unit with the Expert Reconnaissance special rule does not roll for scatter. In addition, friendly Raven Guard formations that enter the battlefield through Teleport and are placed within 15cm of a unit with the Expert Reconnaissance special rule may re-roll 1:s when testing for Teleport Mishap.

rules.title: Webway Portal
description: A army that includes any Webway Portals may place up to three formations in reserve, infantry units in these reserve formations may count as mounted in their transports. These formations may enter play by activating and moving onto the table through a friendly Webway Portal during the game, measuring their first move from any part of the position the portal occupies on the battlefield.

A Webway Portal may only be used once per turn, and if the formation fails to activate when attempting to enter via a Webway, it may only take a hold action offboard and regroup. Only INF, LV, or AVs with the Walker ability may use Webway Portals. H-AV units may not use portals unless noted otherwise.
Each time a formation uses a broken Portal it receives one Blast Marker.

If a Webway is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage that formation(s). In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy formation, any formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible.

rules.title: Large Webway Portal
description: Large Webway Portals follows all the rules for a normal Webway Portals, except AV units are not required to have Walker in order to enter the battlefield through it.

rules.title: Farsight
description: Eldar formations that include a unit with the Farsight ability may ignore the -1 penalty to Action test rolls when attempting to retain the Initiative.

In addition once per turn the Eldar player may attempt to retain the Initiative twice in a row (i.e. allowing the Eldar player to take 3 activations in a row). Any Eldar formation may be selected, including those without a unit with Farsight, but at least one unit with the Farsight ability must be in play on the battlefield.
The formation selected must still carry out an Action Test with a -1 modifier, unless the selected formation has a unit with the Farsight ability.

rules.title: Hit and Run
description: Eldar/Dark Eldar/Harlequin formations that perform an Advance or Double action may choose to shoot either before or after each move, but may still only shoot once. If the formation chooses to Double the -1 to hit penalty applies even if the shot is taken before moving. In addition, formations that win an assault may consolidate up to their speed value rather than the normal 5cms.

rules.title: Holofields (x)
description: Holofields provide a saving throw to the value of x. This save may always be taken even against weapons with the Macro Weapon or Titan Killer abilities.

If a unit has Reinforced Armour it may use its re-roll unless hit by a Lance, Macro Weapon or Titan Killer attack but the re-roll uses the units armour value. Hits saved by the Holofield do not generate Blast Markers, even if they have the Disrupt ability.
Against Titan Killer attacks that cause extra damage make one Holofield save roll, if this is successful the unit takes no damage, if the roll fails it suffers all the damage.

Holofield saves can be reduced by modifiers such as the -1 to saves from a cross fire and weapons with the Sniper ability. If a unit with Holofield also has a save from being in Cover, it must choose which save to use.

rules.title: Lance
description: When units with Reinforced Armour are hit by a weapon with the Lance ability they do not get to re-roll failed armour saves.

rules.title: Independent Twins
description: The Independent Twins special rule allows a War Engine formation to operate as two independent War Engines for all purposes, including for determining the army BTS (each unit counts as its own formation worth half of the points value of the original formation, including upgrades). If one of the two War Engines are destroyed, the surviving one immediately recieves a Blast Marker.
In addition, Independent Twins may use the Commander ability with its Twin. In this case, the Commander ability counts as having an unlimited range instead of the normal 5cm.

rules.title: Summoning
description: Any formation that either has a unit with Daemonic Pact or a Daemonic Pact formation upgrade may summon Daemons. Each Daemonic Pact in the army automatically provides one point to the Lesser Daemon Pool at the start of the battle (the player may also purchase additional Lesser Daemon Pool points and/or Greater Daemon Pool points).

Daemon Pools are not faction specific. The size of the Daemon Pools must be visible to all players at all times and it is suggested that either tokens or dice are used to indicate the size of the pool. As daemons are summoned the pool must be changed to reflect its current size.

To summon daemons the formation declares its intention to summon before any action roll is made (but after the choice of action). If the formation that wishes to Summon is being transported inside another formation (e.g. a Chaos Thunderhawk) it cannot choose to Summon when the Chaos Thunderhawk prepares to activate.

The player then rolls 2D3 to generate the number of Summoning Points available for this formation. The formation may then summon daemons up to the number of Summoning Points generated, with any points not used lost, up to the number of Lesser or Greater Daemon Pool points left.

Summoned units must be setup with their base completely within 5cm of any non-summoned unit in the summoning formation (i.e. You cannot place a chain of summoned units). If the summoning formation has the Transport ability, newly summoned units can be set up inside if there is space left. They cannot be placed in enemy zones of control or impassable terrain. Summoned units become part of the summoning formation for all rules purposes as long as they remain on the battlefield.

Summoned Lesser Daemons are Expendable, but they are otherwise counted as normal units, and are included when working out if a formation outnumbers an opponent in an assault or is broken by Blast Markers, etc. Note that Daemons that are killed in an assault do count towards the number of units killed by the enemy when working out modifiers for assault resolution.

Summoned units remain in play until the End Phase of the turn in which they were summoned. After all formations have attempted to rally any summoned units are removed from play and the total of their Daemon Pool cost is returned to the relevant Daemon Pool. This may cause the formation to break, if the number of Blast Markers now equals or exceeds the number of units in the formation.
When a formation becomes broken all its summoned units are destroyed.

When calculating victory points, the Lesser Daemon Pool scores half points if the pool has less than or equal to half (round up) its original number of daemons remaining. The Lesser Daemon Pool scores full points if the pool has less than or equal to a quarter (round up) its daemons remaining. Treat Greater Daemons as War Engines for the purpose of calculating victory points.

rules.title: Heralds of Truth
description: Any formation that contains at least one unit with the 'Heralds of Truth' special rule ignores the -1 modifier for enemy formations within 30cm when rallying.

rules.title: Augment Summoning (+x)
description: Units with Augment Summoning (+x) add a number of summoning points equal to 'x' when the formation they are in summons daemons (see Summoning). For example, a unit noted as having Augment Summoning (+2) would allow a formation with a Daemonic Pact to roll 2D3+2 for summoning points as opposed to the usual 2D3.

rules.title: Daemonic Focus
description: Units with Daemonic focus may keep any or all summoned units that belong to the formation in play. Summoned units do not vanish back into the warp after the formation has attempted to rally. Daemonic Focus may not be used to keep summoned units in play if the formation is broken. Multiples of Daemonic Focus have no additional effect.

rules.title: Ætheric Dominion (x)
description: Formations where at least one unit has the Ætheric Dominion (x) special rule gain the bonus associated with that Dominion:

• Encroaching Ruin: Formation ignores the -1 modifier for enemy formations within 30cm when rallying.
  • Heedless Slaughter: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Engage.
  • Putrid Corruption: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Marshal.
  • Rapturous Sensation: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Double.
  • Malevolent Artifice: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Advance.
  • Infernal Tempest: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Sustain Fire.
  • Formless Distortion: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Overwatch.
  • Ravenous Dissolution: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to March.

rules.title: Reign of Chaos
description: During the Strategy Phase the Daemon Incursion player rolls 2d6 and picks the highest. In addition add the dice together and consult the following table:
(2-3) *Chaotic Ebb* All Daemon Legion units (friend and foe) loses their Invulnerable Save for the rest of the turn.
(4-5) *The Winds Recede* All players that can summon Daemons lose 1D3 Lesser Daemons Pool points. Daemon Incursion players lose an additional D3. If the pool is empty nothing happens.
(6-8) *Eye of the Storm* Nothing happens.
(9-10) *The Winds Wax* All players that can summon Daemons gains 1D3 Lesser Daemons Pool points. Daemon Incursion players gains an additional D3.
(11-12) *Chaotic Surge* All Daemon Legion units (friend and foe) improves their Invulnerable Save to 5+ for the rest of the turn.

rules.title: The Great Ritual
description: All Exalted Greater Daemons and all Daemon Legion formations must be held in the reserves at the start of the game. Exalted Greater Daemons may either enter the battlefield through a Warp Rift, or they can enter through a Chaos Gate (even if they had previously plotted a Warp Rift). Daemon Legion formations may only enter the battlefield through a Chaos Gate.

rules.title: Terror From Beyond
description: All Exalted Greater Daemon formations must be destroyed in order for the opponent to claim the Daemonic Incursion BTS objective. All Exalted Greater Daemon formations in the reserves are destroyed if they are still there during the End Phase of turn 3.

In addition, as long as the Daemon Incursion army still contains any Exalted Greater Daemons it may re-roll a single failed Initiative test of any type once per turn. If all Exalted Greater Daemons are in the Reserves they may only use the re-roll on themselves.

rules.title: Daemonic Instability
description: When any Exalted Greater Daemon formation or Daemon Legions formation becomes broken for any reason, it is immediately destroyed.

rules.title: Warp Rift
description: Formations with at least one model with the Warp Rift special rule must start the game in the reserves, and may only enter the battlefield through a Warp Rift or a Chaos Gate.

Warp Rifts are plotted exactly as Self Planetfall. Both the turn in which the formation arrives and the landing coordinates must be recorded. The turn each formation arrives does not have to be announced.
The plotted coordinates of the Warp Rift must be located within 60cm from the friendly Blitz objective if the formation arrives in turn one, and anywhere on the battlefield on turn two or three.
On the designated turn the Warp Rift formation is activated in the normal activation sequence, as with Self Planetfall.

First the action for the formation must be decided. After this roll to summon daemons, and then roll to activate. If the formation fails to activate it must take a Hold action. It may then either enter the battlefield through any available Chaos Gate, or its arrival is delayed to the following turn, and it remains in the reserves.
If the activation is successful, place a Warp Rift token at the plotted coordinates. It does not scatter.

If a Warp Rift would open on terrain that is impassable for units in the formation that will enter through it, under a friendly unit, or in an enemy zone of control, then it is assumed that will divert towards another entry point. The location for the Warp Rift should be moved to the nearest point where it can open.

Finally, the activated formation carries out the order determined at the start of its action, and must move the formation out of the Warp Rift. Measure all distances from the centre point of the token.
All units from the activating formation must move out of the Warp Rift. Any units that are unable to exit the Warp Rift are destroyed. The Warp Rift token is then removed from the battlefield.

rules.title: Chaos Gate
description: Daemonic Incursion formations that are located in the Reserves may use Chaos Gates to enter the battlefield. Any number of formations can use a Chaos Gate per turn if it is part of an objective, but only one formation per turn can use a Chaos Gate mounted on a War Engine.

First the action for the formation must be decided. After this roll to summon daemons, and then roll to activate. If the formation fails to activate it must take a Hold action. It may then either enter the battlefield through any available Chaos Gate, or choose to remain in the reserves.
Chaos Gates that are part of objectives cannot be destroyed, while Chaos Gates mounted on War Engines are destroyed if that War Engine is destroyed.

Any formation that enters the battlefield through a Chaos Gate mounted on a War Engine that is broken recieves a Blast Marker. Measure all movement from the Chaos Gate from the centre of the token, or the edge of the War Engine.

If a Chaos Gate is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage that formation(s). In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy formation, any formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible.

rules.title: The Harrowing
description: Alpha Legion armies counts as having Strategy Rating 5 for all purposes except for the Strategy Roll at the start of a turn.

rules.title: Sabotage
description: Before rolling for the first turn and before teleports the player may select one enemy formation per formation of containing at least one unit with the 'Sabotage' special rule (both formations must have been deployed on the battlefield) and roll a D6.

On 2-5, the enemy formation begins the game with a Blast Marker. On a roll of 6, it begins with d3 Blast Markers. On a roll of 1, the formation with 'Sabotage' recieves a Blast Marker. No formation may be subject to Sabotage more than once, even if the first roll is a 1.

rules.title: Alpha Legion Transports
description: The Alpha Legion are a highly mobile army. Because of this, the points cost of a detachment usually includes enough Rhino transport vehicles to transport it and any upgrades that have been taken. Determine the number of Rhinos needed after all upgrades have been purchased. The number of Rhinos will always be the minimum needed to carry the formation, you can’t take extras along to cover any losses!

Note that many formations don’t receive Rhinos, usually because they can’t fit into them. Detachments that come with Rhinos will be noted as having plus transport in the units section of the army list opposite.

Also note that you don’t have to take Rhinos if you don’t want to. If you’d rather field the formation on foot instead, so it can act as a garrison for example, or be transported in a Storm Eagle, then you may do so.

In addition, you may choose to replace a detachment’s Rhinos with Drop Pods. If you do this then the detachment will enter play in a Drop Pods using the rules for Planetfall (see Planetfall). Note that if you choose to do this you will also require a Chaos Strike Cruiser deploy the Drop Pods from.

Before each game, after the opposing army is known but before objectives are placed, the Alpha Legion player may choose which formations with the plus transport aspect are deployed in Rhinos, Drop Pods or on foot. If the formation has any units unable to deploy in Drop Pods then that option cannot be selected.

rules.title: In Midnight Clad
description: Furies of Chaos Undivided that are killed in an assault do not count for Combat Resolution as long as the controlling Night Lords player initiated the assault.

rules.title: Regeneration
description: The 'Regeneration' special rule functions exactly like an Invulnerable Save except that it is a 5+ save rather than 6+. Against Titan Killer attacks, WE must make one Regeneration save against each point of damage.

rules.title: Invincibility
description: The 'Invincibility' special rule functions exactly like an Invulnerable Save except that it is a 4+ save rather than 6+. Against Titan Killer attacks, WE must make one Invincibility save against each point of damage.

rules.title: Harvester
description: Once per action by any formation, if a formation with a unit with the Harvester special rule takes damage, it may reroll one failed Regeneration save. During Enganges, one reroll may be made per round.

rules.title: Necron Portals
description: Necron Portals can only be used by INF and by any AV or LV unit that has Walker. Each portal can be used only once per turn for either entering or exiting the battlefield, but not both.

A formation that is in the reserves may enter play via a unit with Portal as part of any action that allows movement. Measure their movement using the centre of the objective (in case of a Tomb Complex) or edge of the unit. Formations may also leave the board and re-enter the reserves by moving into a Portal. Additionally a formation can leave the board by having a portal pick them up, in a similar way an air transport can pick up friendly units. When a unit with Portal ends an action within 5cm of all units in a friendly formation the Necron player can chose to activate the portal to move that formation back to the reserves. Broken units with Portal can not be used to pick up formations in this way.

When a formation enters the reserves the formation can re-enter play immediately via another Portal or stay in the reserves. Entering or exiting a Portal requires a full move, meaning that a formation using a double action can exit the battlefield in the first move and use it's second move to enter play again using another Portal, but a formation can not use an advance or engage action to enter one and exit another Portal as part of the same move. Any units that are out of coherency at the end of any move is destroyed. A formation picked up by a Portal must remain in the reserves until they can activate to re-enter play. A formation can activate to enter play on the same turn it was picked up, given that the formation had not already activated before it was picked up.

Each time a formation uses a Portal on a unit that is broken, it receives one Blast Marker. This also goes for broken formations using a broken portal, meaning that one unit will be lost unless all units are fearless.

If a Portal is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage the blocking formation. In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy unit, the portal can still be used to enter the battlefield but the formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible with the blocking units.

rules.title: Implacable Advance
description: Necron formations receive a +1 bonus when attempting to perform a Marshal action, but suffer a -1 penalty when attempting to perform a March action.

rules.title: Phase Out
description: At the end of any action by any formation, if a broken Necron formation has lost half or more of its starting number of units, it Phases Out. This means that it is removed from the battlefield, and counts as destroyed for victory condition purposes.

rules.title: Enduring
description: Necron formations containing units with Enduring don’t Phase Out. If the formation has lost all units with Enduring it Phase Out as normal.

rules.title: Big Mek
description: Every Gargant Big Mob army must include a Supreme Command character called a Big Mek, which is free. The Big Mek will join most expensive war engine in the army.

rules.title: Battlefortresses and Gunfortresses
description: Battlefortresses and Gunfortresses may only transport units from their own formation (i.e., the rules for War Engine transports do not apply to them when using the tournament army lists).

rules.title: Power Fields
description: Some Ork war engines are protected by banks of power fields. The number each war engine has is noted on its datasheet. Power fields work in exactly the same manner as Void Shields (see Void Shields), with the sole exception that they may not be repaired once they have been knocked down by a hit, and will instead remain down for the remainder of the battle. In the case of a variable amount of power fields, roll for them straight after the formation is deployed on the table or offboard.

rules.title: Super-Expendable
description: A formation does not receive a Blast Marker when a unit with Super-Expendable is destroyed, this includes the extra Blast Marker from the first casualty of a crossfire and for units destroyed for being out of formation after a move. If a Super-Expendable unit is hit by a weapon with Disrupt it does not inflict a Blast Marker.
Super-Expendable units killed in an assault do not count when working out the result.
Formations comprised completely of Expendable and/or Super-Expendable units do not benefit from any of the rules above.

rules.title: Snakebite Clan Warlords
description: Every Snakebite Clan army must include a Supreme Command character called a Warlord. The Warlord character is free, you don’t have to pay any points for it. The Warlord must be attached to a unit of Brutes in the scrappiest formation in the army (i.e. the formation with the most units that also contains a unit of Brutes. War Engines counts as one unit per DC).

rules.title: Push 'Em Harder Ladz
description: Whenever any type of Gargant passes an Action Test that allows movement, the player may opt to change the unit's speed rating to 20cm for the entire duration of the chosen Action, however if this ability is used the model will receive a Critical Hit for with each move that is carried out.

rules.title: Mob Rule
description: Orks believe that as long as there’s a bunch of them still fighting together (slightly more than they can count up to is ideal!) then there’s always a chance that they’ll prevail, no matter the odds. To represent this, Ork formations with more than five units (i.e., too many to count on the fingers of one hand), not including Grotz or Big Gunz units, receive a +1 modifier to any rally rolls they make, and formations with more than 10 such units receive a +2 modifier. For the purposes of this rule War Engines count each point of starting damage capacity as a unit. War Engines with the 'God Machine' special rule always counts as being more than 10 units.

rules.title: ‘Ere we Go
description: Units with the ‘Ere we Go special rule gain an additional 5cm Speed when their formation performs an Engage Action.

rules.title: Rush ‘em Ladz
description: Formations that contain one or more units with the Rush ‘em Ladz special rule receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test roll when attempting to carry out a March action.

rules.title: Power of the Waaagh!
description: Orks are not noted for their organisational abilities, and thus usually have a pretty low Initiative. However, if there is one thing that will galvanise an Ork warband, it’s the thought of a good punch-up! Because of this, Ork formations that are attempting to take engage or double actions receive a +2 modifier to their Action Test roll. Ork Flyboyz similarly relish the chance to shoot things up, and receive a +2 modifier to their Action Test roll when attempting to carry out Interception or Ground Attack actions (see Aircraft).

rules.title: Clan Goffs Warlord
description: Every Warhorde army must include a Supreme Commander character called a Warlord. The Warlord character is free, you don’t have to pay any points for it. If the army includes any Great Gargants, then the Warlord must be placed in one of them. Otherwise the Warlord will join a Gargant or Nobz unit.

rules.title: Speed Freeks Warlord
description: Every Speed Freaks army must include a supreme commander called a Mekboy Bad Ork Biker. The Mekboy Bad Ork Biker unit is free; you don’t have to pay any points for it. The Mekboy Bad Ork Biker unit may be added to any Ork formation in the army.

rules.title: Speed Freeks
description: Every unit in a Evil Sunz Speed Freeks army must either have a speed of 30cm plus, or be transported in a unit with a speed of 30cm plus. In other words, formations may not include units with a speed of less than 30cm unless they also have a transport vehicle capable of carrying the unit around.

rules.title: Coordinated Fire
description: A formation that contains at least one unit with Coordinated Fire can order up to two other un-broken formations within 15cm that have not taken an action this turn to follow their own formation when they take an Advance, Double or Sustained Fire action.

Make a single Initiative roll for all foarmations, counting a single -1 modifier if any have Blast Markers. If the test is failed then the original formation (containing the unit calling for Coordinated Fire) receives a Blast Marker and must take a hold action. The other formations are unaffected (and may take an action later in the turn). If the test is passed then all formations concerned are allowed to take either an Advance, Double or Sustained Fire action.

There is no obligation for all formations to take the same action, and these actions may be resolved in any order, but they must all fire at the same target formation. If the formation being activated is unable or unwilling to fire at the selected formation, it cannot fire at all that turn. The formations don’t have to stay within a given distance of each other and will complete their actions one after the other. Each formations action is declared and resolved (including testing to see if the target formation breaks) before moving on to the next Tau formation.

rules.title: Guided Missiles
description: Guided Missiles may be fired without Line of Sight, but may only be fired at a targets that are Marked with Markerlights.

Guided Missiles follow all the normal suppression rules. If a unit with a Guided Missile weapon is within range and Line of Sight to a unit in the target formation then it is counted for suppression purposes, even if the target formation is not Marked.
Guided Missiles counts as having Line of Sight to all units in a Marked formation for the purpose of suppression, Crossfire and when shooting as part of an Overwatch action.

rules.title: Markerlights
description: All enemy formations with at least one unit within 30cm range and Line of Sight of at least one Tau unit with the Markerlights special rule is considered to be Marked. When shooting at a Marked formation, all ranged firepower attacks gain an additional +1 modifier to their To-Hit roll. This bonus for shooting at a Marked enemy may not be used when making Anti-Aircraft attacks, or with BP type attacks. A Tau formation that is broken or has Marched this turn may not mark enemy formations.

rules.title: General Tournament Tiebreaker Rules
description: If a player gives up the game, or does not show up within 30 minutes it is scored as a Total Victory for the opponent. If a game must be abandoned before turn 4 because of lack of time, the current objective total determines the score, with a -4 penalty for both sides if the game ended prematurely in turn 2, and a -2 penalty for both sides if the game ended prematurely in turn 3. If one player was late to the game start by more than 5 minutes, that player takes both player’s penalties.

rules.title: Teleport Homer
description: Units that Teleport within 15 cm from a friendly, unbroken unit with Teleport Homer already on the battlefield may re-roll 1:s when testing for Teleport Mishap. May not be used if there are any unbroken enemy units with the 'Psyker', 'Daemonic', or 'Prescience' special rules within 15 cm of the unit.

rules.title: Offboard Support
description: Calling for Offboard Support is a new action that a player can take after having completed an Advance, Overwatch, Marshal, or Sustain Fire action with an unbroken formation that contains a unit with the Vox-Caster special rule. This counts as retaining the initiative, and thus cannot be done if the initiative has already been retained once. The Offboard Support action automatically succeeds.

Unless otherwise specified in the description of the Offboard Support asset, the following procedure is used. Place a marker within x cm (depending on the type of Offboard Support) within Line of Sight of the unit with the Vox-Caster special rule to indicate where the Offboard Support asset will come down/up. The Offboard Support is then carried out according to its special rules before the start of the next friendly action, or before the end phase, depending on which comes first.

rules.title: Teleport
description: A formation consisting completely of units with the 'Teleport' special rule must be placed in the reserves before deployment. They may only enter the battlefield through an Offboard Support action. Immediately place the formation with all units completely within 15 cm of the unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule, and roll a D6 for each, to test if any teleport mishaps occured. For each roll of 1, the teleporting formation suffers a BM.

Unlike some other Offboard Support actions, Teleporting grants immediately grants the controlling player the chance to retain the initiative twice, meaning that the formation that just arrived may attempt carry out an action.

rules.title: Drop Pods
description: A formation consisting completely of units of INF (without the 'Bulky', 'Jump Packs' or 'Mounted' special rules), and/or LV & AV with the 'Nimble' special rules may be placed in Drop Pods. These must be placed in the reserves after objectives have been placed, but before garrisons. They may only enter the battlefield through an Offboard Support action. Place the Drop Pod with its center within 15 cm of the unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule. Calling down a Drop Pod counts as an additional action, so the player using it may not retain the initiative afterwards.

Once the Drop Pod arrives at the battlefield, move the Drop Pod marker up to 15 cm in any direction that does not place it in an enemy zone of control. Any enemy units within 10 cm of the centre of the drop pod are attacked by an AP6+/AT6+ (Disrupt) attack. After these attacks have been resolved, place the Drop Pods contents fully within 10 cm of the centre of the Drop Pod.

rules.title: Dreadclaws
description: A formation consisting completely of units of INF (without the 'Jump Packs' or 'Mounted' special rules), and/or LV & AV with the 'Nimble' special rules may be placed in Dreadclaws. These must be placed in the reserves after objectives have been placed, but before garrisons. They may only enter the battlefield through an Offboard Support action. Place the Dreadclaw with its center within 15 cm of the unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule. Calling down a Dreadclaw counts as an additional action, so the player using it may not retain the initiative afterwards.

Once the Dreadclaw arrives at the battlefield, move the Dreadclaw marker up to 20 cm in any direction that does not place it in an enemy zone of control. Then place the Dreadclaw contents fully within 10 cm of the centre of the Dreadclaw.

rules.title: Deathwind
description: A Deathwind attack places a marker within 15 cm of the model with 'Vox-Caster'. Once it arrives on the battlefield, it may be moved by 15 cm in any direction. Place the large barrage template with the centre hole over the marker. Any model under the template is attacked by a AP6+/AT6+ (Disrupt) attack

rules.title: Palisade Drop Pod
description: A Palisade Drop Pod may only be used alongside other Drop Pods, and is added to a formation in Drop Pods or Dreadclaws during deployment. All models in the formation counts as being in Cover and gains the Invulnerable Save special rule for the purposes of Overwatch when they exit their Drop Pods.

rules.title: Subterranean Assault
description: A Subterranean Assault may only enter the battlefield through an Offboard Support action. Place a tunneling marker with its center within 5 cm of the unit with the 'Vox-Caster' special rule.

The tunneling marker may only be placed on the friendly half of the battlefield during the first turn but can be anywhere on the battlefield from the second turn onwards. Calling for a Subterranean Assault counts as an additional action, so the player using it may not retain the initiative afterwards.

Once the Subterranean Assault arrives at the battlefield, move the tunneling marker up to 15 cm in any direction that does not place it in an enemy zone of control or inside terrain that is impassable for AV and/or WE. Then place the unit(s) transporting the Subterranean Assault fully within 10 cm of the centre of the tunneling marker with the transported units inside. The surfacing of a Subterranean Assault transport is not considered to be movement for the purposes of Overwatch, and does not count as an action for the formation.

rules.title: Ordinatus Aktaeus Subterranean Assault
description: An Ordinatus Aktaeus Burrowing Transport has the 'Assault Transport (8)' special rule. Any formation transported inside must be placed in the reserves after objectives have been placed, but before garrisons. It will enter play using the 'Tunnelers' special rule. The Hellbore Burrowing Transport does not count as part of the formation it transports after entering the battlefield, but acts like any WE transport.

rules.title: Hellbore Subterranean Assault
description: A Hellbore Burrowing Transport has the 'Assault Transport (12)' special rule. Any formation transported inside must be placed in the reserves after objectives have been placed, but before garrisons. It will enter play using the 'Tunnelers' special rule. The Hellbore Burrowing Transport does not count as part of the formation it transports after entering the battlefield, but acts like any WE transport.

rules.title: Ordinatus Aktaeus Subterranean Assault
description: Any non-allied formation consisting completely of units of INF, and/or LV & AV with the 'Nimble' special rules and is no more than eight units large may be mounted in an Ordinatus Aktaeus Burrowing Transport. These must be placed in the reserves after objectives have been placed, but before garrisons. It will enter play using the 'Tunnelers' special rule. The Hellbore Burrowing Transport does not count as part of the formation it transports after entering the battlefield, but acts like any WE transport.

rules.title: Orbital Pin-Point Attack
description: A Pin-Point attack has a range of 30 cm, and may only be targeted at War Engines. Once it arrives on the battlefield, it will inflict an automatic MW, TK(D3) attack on a single War Engine under the center of the marker.

rules.title: Orbital Barrage
description: An Orbital Barrage has a range of 45 cm. Once it arrives on the battlefield, place the small barrage template with its centre over the marker. Any unit under the template is attacked by an AP4+/AT5+ (MW, Siege) attack.

rules.title: Orbital Phospex Barrage
description: A Phospex Strike has a range of 45 cm. Once it arrives on the battlefield, place the small barrage template with its centre over the marker. Any unit under the template is attacked by an AP4+/AT6+ (Disrupt, Ignore Cover) attack.

rules.title: Orbital Rad Barrage
description: A Rad Barrage has a range of 45 cm. Once it arrives on the battlefield, place the large barrage template with its centre over the marker. All units under the template is attacked by an AP3+/AT6+ (Rad, Ignore Cover) attack.

rules.title: Orbital Haywire Barrage
description: A Haywire Barrage has a range of 45 cm. Once it arrives on the battlefield, place the large barrage template with its centre over the marker. All units under the template is attacked by an AP6+/AT3+ (Rad, Ignore Cover) attack.

rules.title: Artillery Barrage
description: An Artillery Barrage has a range of 30 cm. Unlike other Offboard Support assets, Artillery strikes arrive immediately. Place the small barrage template with its centre over the marker. Any unit under the template is attacked by an AP3+/AT6+ (Disrupt, Siege) attack.

rules.title: Artillery Phospex Barrage
description: An Artillery Barrage has a range of 30 cm. Unlike other Offboard Support assets, Artillery strikes arrive immediately. Place the small barrage template with its centre over the marker. Any unit under the template is attacked by an AP5+/AT6+ (Disrupt, IC) attack.

rules.title: Artillery Minefield Strike
description: A Minefield Submunitions attack has a range of 30 cm. Unlike other Offboard Support assets, Artillery strikes arrive immediately. Place a Minefield template (same size as a small barrage template) with its centre over the marker. No part of the template may be placed over any terrain or model. For the rest of the battle, this area is now considered to be dangerous terrain.

rules.title: Artillery Blind Strike
description: A Blind Burst is targeted at any friendly formation within 30 cm. Place a Blind marker next to the targeted formation. For the rest of the turn, the entire formation counts as being in Cover. Unlike other Offboard Support assets, Artillery strikes arrive immediately.

rules.title: Divisio Assassinorum and Cults Abominatio
description: Assassins may be placed in a formation with a Vox-Caster using a Offboard Support action. Place an appropriate marker next to the formation to show that the assassin is now present in that formation. The effect is automatically triggered whenever the formation is next directly involved in an assault. If the formation is broken before this happens, the marker is lost, and the asset may not be used again.

rules.title: Deathstrike Attacks
description: Unlike other Offboard Support assets Deathstrike missiles have unlimited range, but are reliant on more precise targeting data. This means that any marker put down on the battlefield needs to be confirmed by a second Offboard Support action by a unit with 'Vox-Caster' before the attack will commence. All markers that have not been confirmed expire at the end of each turn.

rules.title: Deathstrike Warp Missile Attack
description: A Warp Missile attack may only be targeted at War Engines. Once it arrives on the battlefield, it will inflict an automatic MW, TK(D3), Shield Piercer attack on a single War Engine under the center of the marker.

rules.title: Deathstrike Vortex Missile Attack
description: A Vortex Missile attack places a small barrage template over the marker. All units under it suffers an AP4+/AT4+, MW, TK(1), Shield Disruptor attack.

rules.title: Deathstrike Plasma Missile Attack
description: A Plasma Missile attack places the large barrage template over the marker. All units under it suffers an AP4+/AT5+ attack.

rules.title: Deathstrike Stasis Missile Attack
description: A Stasis Missile attack places the large barrage template over the marker. Any formation with a majority of units under the template suffers an additional -2 to activate this turn. Any formation with less than half of its units under the template suffers an -1 to activate this turn. In addition, any formation under it suffers a BM for coming under fire.
